channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Two dozen callouts as 'downpour' hits Auckland
item.description: The upper North Island has been pelted by thunderstorms overnight, with 49 millimetres of rain falling from midnight to 1am in parts of Auckland.

item.title: Deportees set to spend isolation in same facilities as other travellers
item.description: New Zealanders deported from Australia will go into the same managed isolation and quarantine facilities as other arrivals.

item.title: Disability sector calls for separate ministry, support unshackled from health system
item.description: The government should abandon some recommendations in the "appalling" Health and Disability review, and set up a separate ministry, people across the disability sector say.

item.title: 'We saw some birds get sucked into it': Tornado touches down in Mangawhai
item.description: Mangawhai residents have witnessed birds and roofs being pulled into the vortex as a tornado touched down at the coastal town north of Auckland.

item.title: Travellers from South Korea taken to isolation hotel in Wellington
item.description: New Zealanders returning home on a repatriation flight from South Korea have been taken to a managed isolation hotel in Wellington today, a first for the capital.

item.title: NZers left country during lockdown, returned via stays in managed isolation
item.description: Official figures show 60 people left the country after alert level 4 restrictions were introduced, and returned before May.

item.title: Scott Watson’s murder convictions to be referred to Court of Appeal
item.description: The Governor-General has referred Scott Watson's convictions for murder back to the Court of Appeal, Justice Minister Andrew Little has announced.

item.title: Pedestrian dies after being hit by a car in Auckland
item.description: A person involved in a serious crash in Counties Manukau has died overnight.

item.title: Covid-19 update: One new case in managed isolation
item.description: There is one new case of Covid-19 in New Zealand in managed isolation at an Auckland hotel.

item.title: Man arrested after trying to grab child's hand in South Auckland
item.description: Police have arrested a man after a child was allegedly grabbed on their way to school yesterday in Māngere, South Auckland.

item.title: SS Ventnor film 'just doesn't sit right'
item.description: Almost 120 years after they sank to the bottom of the Tasman Sea, the discovery of the remains of Chinese gold miners is causing fury.

item.title: New Plymouth ratepayers asked to foot $25m Covid-19 airport bill
item.description: New Plymouth Airport is asking ratepayers for bailout of up to $25 million to help it recover from the economic hit of Covid-19.

item.title: Police raids recover cannabis, cash and LSD in Central Otago
item.description: Five people have been arrested on drugs charges after police raids in Central Otago and Queenstown.

item.title: Challenge to gun laws dismissed in High Court
item.description: A request for a review of the changes to gun laws after the Christchurch mosque shootings has been dismissed in the High Court.

item.title: One dead after two vehicle crash near Matamata
item.description: One person has died after a crash between a truck and a ute north of Matamata, near Hamilton.

item.title: Police across the country hold minute silence to honour Constable Matthew Hunt
item.description: At the Memorial Wall at the Royal New Zealand Police College in Porirua, staff and recruits gathered for a wreath laying and a minute of silence.

item.title: Watercare earmarks $57.5m to recommission dam
item.description: Watercare is planning to spend $57.5 million to recommission a mothballed dam in Hūnua to help in the fight against Auckland's water shortages.

item.title: Covid-19: Queenstown businesses question Tourism Minister's absence until now
item.description: Queenstown businesses are questioning why Tourism Minister Kelvin Davis has been absent for so long from the struggling resort town.
